content.title: MANAGE Internship Programme
content.details: The MANAGE Internship Programme offers students the opportunity to gain practical experience in research and extension within the agricultural sector.
benefits: Capacity development in research and extension
Stipend of ₹10,000 per month for a 3-month internship
Stipend of ₹35,000 per month for a 6-month internship
eligibility: Students from Extension Education, Economics, Sociology, Psychology, MSW, Journalism, Communication, and Environmental Science
Minimum cumulative OGPA of 8 out of 10 (minimum 80%) for completed Ph.D. or M.Sc. degrees
Ongoing degree students must have a similar level of academic achievement
Fluency in English and good writing skills
content.application_process: Interested candidates should email their CV, motivation letter, and recommendation letter to Dr. Saravanan Raj at saravananraj.manage@gmail.com.
documents_required: Recommendation letter from the Head of the Department or Chairman of the advisory committee

faqs.question: What are the specific academic disciplines that students should be pursuing in order to be eligible for the MANAGE Internship Programme?
faqs.answer: Students from the disciplines of Extension Education, Economics, Sociology, Psychology, MSW, Journalism, Communication, and Environmental Science are eligible. Applicants with research interests in rural studies are particularly encouraged to apply.

faqs.question: Is English fluency and good writing skills an absolute requirement for the internship?
faqs.answer: Yes, English fluency and good writing skills are essential for the internship.

faqs.question: What is the flexibility in terms of internship duration?
faqs.answer: The MANAGE Internship Programme offers flexibility in terms of duration, with internships ranging from 3 to 6 months.

faqs.question: Are internships available throughout the year?
faqs.answer: Internships are available year-round, providing flexibility for students to apply according to their preferences.

faqs.question: What is the selection process for the MANAGE Internship Programme?
faqs.answer: The selection is based on evaluation of the proposals received, including the assessment of the candidate's CV, motivation letter, and recommendation letter.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to submit a recommendation letter?
faqs.answer: Yes, a recommendation letter from the Head of the Department/Chairman of the advisory committee is required.
